title: Thomas Edison National Historical Park: Photo Gallery
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Photo Gallery              Photo Gallery                    The Greenhouse at Glenmont   3 Photos            Before Renovation   6 Photos  The Laboratory Complex before the renovation project          After Renovation - Current Photos of the Park   8 Photos  A variety of photos from the Laboratory Complex and the Glenmont Estate.             Appliances   2 Photos            Battery, Primary   6 Photos            Battery, Storage   9 Photos  Battery pictures            Cement   12 Photos            Duplicating Machines   1 Photos            Early Talking Doll Recording Discovered   11 Photos  On May 11, 2011, scientists at the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory in Berkeley, California recovered sound from an artifact that historians believe is the earliest surviving talking doll record.            Edison Employees   14 Photos            Edison Portland Cement Company   13 Photos            Theo Wangemann's phonograph   2 Photos  The Edison phonograph used by Theo Wangemann during his trip to Europe in 1889-90. This artifact is now owned by collector Stuart H. Miller, M.D.            Batteries   9 Photos  Edison Storage Batteries          Edison Employees   19 Photos  Edison Employees          Theo Wangemannâ€™s 1889-1890 European wax cylinders   39 Photos  Twelve wax cylinders recorded by Theo Wangemann in Europe during 1889-1890 (arranged here in catalog number order), and the original wooden box in which they were carried.
